summary: Worker starts successfully without any workflows or activities configured, making it difficult to debug. Request to either require at least one workflow/activity/workflowsPath option at type level or add warning logging.
userImpact: Users can unknowingly deploy workers with no workflows/activities configured, causing silent failures that are difficult to debug.
rootCause: Worker options make both workflowsPath and workflowBundle optional, allowing workers to start without any work available.
proposedFix: Either enforce type-level requirement using RequireAtLeastOne utility type, or add warning logs when no workflows/activities are registered.
workaround: Add logging output to show what activities or workflows the worker was able to find during startup.
resolutionDetails: Warning messages for 'no workflows registered' and 'no activity registered' were implemented in PR #808.
keyQuote: The worker happily starts up and does not pick up any work since it's not aware of any workflows it can run. This can be painful to debug.
